s: ^I’m doing well, Mrs.Lee! What are you eating?
^Doing great! I just had lunch and it's a beautiful day. How about you?

Chat1: ^Mrslee?Smiling "I am eating lentil soup that Giancarlo made especially for me. It is very good! Perfect for a day like today."

s: ^That sounds delicious! I’ll have to ask him for the recipe!
^What a good lunch! I was wondering if I could ask you for some help?

Chat2: ^Mrslee?Smiling "Next time, I can bring enough to share! I will bring your favorite citrus candies too."
^Mrslee?Smiling " We can eat in the park, maybe. I love watching the birds. Eddie says not to feed the ducks, though."

s: ^You’re the best! By the way, do you have time for a question?

Chat3: ^Mrslee?Neutral "Eddie says human foods aren't healthy for them. Makes them full, but doesn't contain the right nutrients."
^Mrslee?Neutral "I feel sad when they beg for snacks, but I don't want to make them sick. So, I don't share."

s: ^I didn't know that! Hey, can I ask a question about health?

c-0: ^Smarts run in the family! Can I borrow your smarts?

s: ^Amazing! A friend is worried about a potential chronic illness diagnosis.

Suggestion1: ^Mrslee_Day 4_Learn to listen to your body, and give yourself permission to rest when needed_Lila4-1

Suggestion1.#: notification Mrslee_Day 4_Learn to listen to your body, and give yourself permission to rest when needed_Lila4-1

Suggestion1: ^Mrslee?Neutral "Chronic illnesses are not easy. Tell your friend that many people have very, very good lives with chronic illness."
^Mrslee?Neutral "I have many friends who manage ongoing health challenges. It can be hard to stay on top of everything."
^Mrslee?Neutral "It is common to feel nervous. It is very important to take care of yourself and rest when your body says to rest."
^Mrslee?Neutral "Many struggle with lifestyle changes after diagnosis. There are specific symptoms depending on the illness, but fatigue and sleep problems are very common."
^Mrslee?Neutral "if you are tired or need to rest, it is always better to lie down than to push through."
^Mrslee?Smiilng "It can be hard. We all want to do everything, all the time. But that is not always possible."

s: ^That's useful insight. What else should I tell her?
^How can she find the right type of care?

Suggestion2: ^Mrslee_Day 4_Medical innovations come along all the time -- find a specialist you trust and stay up to date on the latest developments_Lila4-2

Suggestion2.#: notification Mrslee_Day 4_Medical innovations come along all the time -- find a specialist you trust and stay up to date on the latest developments_Lila4-2

Suggestion2: ^Mrslee?Smiling "Learn as much as possible. There's no such thing as too much reading. or asking too many questions."
^Mrslee?Smiling "Scientists and doctors learn more every year. Medicine and technology change so fast! There are advancements everyday that help people be healthy."
^Mrslee?Neutral "Your primary care doctor will help know what type of specialist to find. Chronic illness often requires a team."

s: ^I’ll never say no to more time with you, or soup!
